items.Grade1: Hemoglobin (Hgb) <LLN - 10.0 g/dL; <LLN - 6.2 mmol/L; <LLN - 100 g/L
items.Grade3: Hgb <8.0 g/dL; <4.9 mmol/L; <80 g/L; transfusion indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.

items.CTCAETerm: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Mildly hypocellular or <=25% reduction from normal cellularity for age
items.Grade2: Moderately hypocellular or >25 - <50% reduction from normal cellularity for age
items.Grade3: Severely hypocellular or >50 - <=75% reduction cellularity from normal for age
items.Grade4: Aplastic persistent for longer than 2 weeks
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

items.Grade2: Laboratory findings with no bleeding
items.Grade3: Laboratory findings and bleeding
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by systemic pathological activation of blood clotting mechanisms which results in clot formation throughout the body. There is an increase in the risk of hemorrhage as the body is depleted of platelets and coagulation factors.

items.Grade1: >ULN and >Baseline
items.Grade3: Steroids initiated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of eosinophils in the blood.

items.Grade3: ANC <1000/mm3 with a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an ANC <1000/mm3 and a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

items.Grade1: Laboratory evidence of hemolysis only (e.g., direct antiglobulin test; DAT; Coombs'; schistocytes; decreased haptoglobin)
items.Grade2: Evidence of hemolysis and >=2 g decrease in hemoglobin
items.Grade3: Transfusion or medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate widespread erythrocyte cell membrane destruction.

items.Grade3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and severe thrombocytopenia.

items.Grade4: Clinical manifestations of leucostasis; urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in a lymph node.

items.Grade2: >ULN
items.Grade3: Requiring urgent intervention
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate increased methemoglobin in the blood.

items.Grade3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenic purpura, fever, renal abnormalities and neurological abnormalities such as seizures, hemiplegia, and visual disturbances. It is an acute or subacute condition.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in aortic valve function or structure.

items.Grade1: Periods of asystole; non-urgent medical management indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without cardiac electrical activity. Typically, this is accompanied by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation; new onset
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible P waves and an irregular ventricular response due to multiple reentry circuits. The rhythm disturbance originates above the ventricles.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with organized rhythmic atrial contractions with a rate of 200-300 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

items.Grade2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the AV node to the ventricles.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a delay in the time required for the conduction of an electrical impulse through the atrioventricular (AV) node beyond 0.2 seconds; prolongation of the PR interval greater than 200 milliseconds.
A disorder characterized by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; pain on exertion; limiting instrumental ADL; hemodynamically stable
items.Grade3: Pain at rest; limiting self care ADL; cardiac catheterization; new onset cardiac chest pain; unstable angina
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by substernal discomfort due to insufficient myocardial oxygenation e.g., angina pectoris.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction.
items.CTCAEv5Change: Addition: Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2, 3, Definition

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by pathological irregularities in the cardiac conduction system.

items.Grade2: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a bluish discoloration of the skin and/or mucous membranes.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
items.Grade2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
items.Grade3: Symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; hospitalization; new onset of symptoms
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate volume to meet tissue metabolic requirements, or, the ability to do so only at an elevation in the filling pressure.
items.NavigationalNote: If left sided use Cardiac disorders: Left ventricular systolic dysfunction; also consider Cardiac disorders: Restrictive cardiomyopathy, Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

items.Grade3: Symptomatic due to drop in ejection fraction responsive to intervention
items.Grade4: Refractory or poorly controlled heart failure due to drop in ejection fraction; intervention such as ventricular assist device, intravenous vasopressor support, or heart transplant indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by failure of the left ventricle to produce adequate output.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in mitral valve function or structure.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a progressively lengthening PR interval prior to the blocking of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

items.Grade2: Asymptomatic and cardiac enzymes minimally abnormal and no evidence of ischemic ECG changes
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; cardiac enzymes abnormal; hemodynamically stable; ECG changes consistent with infarction
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

items.Grade2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
items.Grade3: Severe with symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; intervention indicated; new onset of symptoms
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the muscle tissue of the heart.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; ablation
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; incompletely controlled medically; cardioversion indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with abrupt onset and sudden termination of atrial contractions with a rate of 150-250 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

items.Grade2: Asymptomatic effusion size small to moderate
items.Grade3: Effusion with physiologic consequences
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
A disorder characterized by an increase in intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, ECG or physical findings (e.g., rub) consistent with pericarditis
items.Grade2: Symptomatic pericarditis (e.g., chest pain)
items.Grade3: Pericarditis with physiologic consequences (e.g., pericardial constriction)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by irritation to the layers of the pericardium (the protective sac around the heart).

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

items.Grade1: Imaging findings only
items.Grade2: Symptomatic without signs of heart failure
items.Grade3: Symptomatic heart failure or other cardiac symptoms, responsive to intervention; new onset of symptoms
items.Grade4: Refractory heart failure or other poorly controlled cardiac symptoms
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and loses its flexibility.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
items.Grade2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., ventricular assist device); heart transplant indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by impairment of right ventricular function associated with low ejection fraction and a decrease in motility of the right ventricular wall.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with alternating periods of bradycardia and atrial tachycardia accompanied by syncope, fatigue and dizziness.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate less than 60 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates above the ventricles.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis
items.Grade2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
items.Grade3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in tricuspid valve function or structure.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.
A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible QRS complexes due to rapid repetitive excitation of myocardial fibers without coordinated contraction of the ventricles.

items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates distal to the bundle of His.

items.CTCAETerm: Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.CTCAETerm: Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the ear.

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the external ear region.

items.Grade4:
Adults: Decrease in hearing to profound bilateral loss (absolute threshold >80 dB HL at 2 kHz and above); nonservicable hearing

Pediatric: Audiologic indication for cochlear implant; > 40 dB HL (i.e., 45 dB HL or more); SNHL at 2 kHz and above
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to ear structures.

items.Grade1: Serous otitis
items.Grade2: Serous otitis, medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Mastoiditis; necrosis of canal soft tissue or bone
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation (physiologic response to irritation), swelling and redness to the middle ear.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by noise in the ears, such as ringing, buzzing, roaring or clicking.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo).

items.Grade2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the adrenal cortex not producing enough of the hormone cortisol and in some cases, the hormone aldosterone. It may be due to a disorder of the adrenal cortex as in Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms that resemble Cushing's disease or syndrome: buffalo hump obesity, striations, adiposity, hypertension, diabetes, and osteoporosis, usually due to exogenous corticosteroids.

items.Grade2: No breast development by age 13 yrs for females; testes volume of <3 cc or no Tanner Stage 2 development by age 14.5 yrs for males
items.Grade3: No breast development by age 14 yrs for females; no increase in testes volume or no Tanner Stage 2 by age 16 yrs for males; hormone replacement indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by unusually late sexual maturity.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade2: >= +2 SD (standard deviation) above mid parental height or target height
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by greater growth than expected for age.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands. This results in hypercalcemia (abnormally high levels of calcium in the blood).

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; thyroid suppression therapy indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive levels of thyroid hormone in the body. Common causes include an overactive thyroid gland or thyroid hormone overdose.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation and cellular infiltration of the pituitary gland.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of hormones from the pituitary gland.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; thyroid replacement indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of thyroid hormone by the thyroid gland.

items.Grade1: Physical signs of puberty with no biochemical markers for females <8 years and males <9 years
items.Grade2: Physical signs and biochemical markers of puberty for females <8 years and males <9 years
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by unusually early development of secondary sexual features; the onset of sexual maturation begins usually before age 8 for girls and before age 9 for boys.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; mild symptoms with no intervention indicated
items.Grade2: Replacement therapy initiated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by low testosterone.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inappropriate masculinization occurring in a female or prepubertal male.

items.Grade1: Intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by visual perception of unclear or fuzzy images.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); glare symptoms affecting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes. This results in a decrease in visual acuity and eventual blindness if untreated.

items.Grade3: Corneal ulcer without perforation in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an area of epithelial tissue loss on the surface of the cornea. It is associated with inflammatory cells in the cornea and anterior chamber.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; symptoms relieved by lubricants
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva.
items.NavigationalNote: If corneal ulcer is present, grade under Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
items.Grade2: Unilateral paresis without double vision
items.Grade3: Bilateral paresis or unilateral paresis causing double vision in peripheral gaze, but not in central gaze
items.Grade4: Bilateral paresis requiring head turning to see beyond central 60 degrees or double vision in central gaze
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by incomplete paralysis of an extraocular muscle.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; no change in vision
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL; best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately sight-threatening; limiting self care ADL; decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
items.Grade4: Sight-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the eye.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; nonoperative intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Limiting self care ADL; operative intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by impaired eyelid function.

items.Grade1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
items.Grade2: Limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden or brief burst of light.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

items.Grade1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
items.Grade2: Limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an individual seeing spots before their eyes. The spots are shadows of opaque cell fragments in the vitreous humor or lens.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

items.Grade1: Less than 8 mmHg of elevated intraocular pressure (EIOP); no visual field deficit
items.Grade2: EIOP which can be reduced to 21 mmHg or under with topical medications and no visual field deficit
items.Grade3: EIOP causing visual field deficits
items.Grade4: Visual field deficit within the central 10 degrees of the visual field in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the aqueous humor outflow.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); corneal ulcer; limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Perforation; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the cornea of the eye.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer
items.CTCAEv5Change: Addition: Grade 1, Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2, 3, 4

items.Grade1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to see clearly in dim light.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
items.Grade2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
items.Grade3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the optic nerve (second cranial nerve).

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; no visual field deficit
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by swelling around the optic disc.

items.Grade1: Soft or non-pitting
items.Grade2: Indurated or pitting edema; topical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Edema associated with visual disturbance; increased intraocular pressure, glaucoma or retinal hemorrhage; optic neuritis; diuretics indicated; operative intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid around the orbits of the face.

items.Grade1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
items.Grade2: Limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by fear and avoidance of light.

items.Grade3: Macular sparing rhegmatogenous detachment
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium.

items.Grade1: No retinal detachment and treatment not indicated
items.Grade2: No retinal detachment and treatment indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a small laceration of the retina, this occurs when the vitreous separates from the retina. Symptoms include flashes and floaters.
items.NavigationalNote: If retinal detachment is present, grade under Eye disorders: Retinal detachment
items.CTCAEv5Change: Addition: Grade 1, Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 2; Deletion: Grade 3, 4

items.Grade2: Retinal vascular disorder without neovascularization
items.Grade3: Retinal vascular disorder with neovascularization
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by pathological retinal blood vessels that adversely affects vision.
items.NavigationalNote: If vitreous hemorrhage is present, report under Eye disorders: Vitreous hemorrhage.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
items.Definition: A disorder involving the retina.
items.NavigationalNote: If vitreous hemorrhage is present, report under Eye disorders: Vitreous hemorrhage.

items.Grade1: No change in vision from baseline

items.Grade1:
Adult: Radiologic evidence of osteoporosis or Bone Mineral Density (BMD) t-score -1 to -2.5 (osteopenia); 

Pediatric: Radiologic evidence of low BMD with z score of <= -2.0 and no history of significant fractures
items.Grade2:
Adult: BMD t-score < -2.5; loss of height <2 cm; therapy to improve BMD indicated; limiting instrumental ADL;

Pediatric: Low BMD (z-score <= -2.0) and significant fracture history (defined as a long bone fracture of the lower extremity, vertebral compression, 2 or more long bone fractures of the upper extremities); therapy to improve BMD indicated
items.Grade3:
Adult: Loss of height >=2 cm; hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL; 

Pediatric: Limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; small focal T2/FLAIR hyperintensities; involving periventricular white matter or <1/3 of susceptible areas of cerebrum +/- mild increase in subarachnoid space (SAS) and/or mild ventriculomegaly
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; focal T2/FLAIR hyperintensities, involving periventricular white matter extending into centrum semiovale or involving 1/3 to 2/3 of susceptible areas of cerebrum +/- moderate increase in SAS and/or moderate ventriculomegaly
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; extensive T2/FLAIR hyperintensities, involving periventricular white matter involving 2/3 or more of susceptible areas of cerebrum +/- moderate to severe increase in SAS and/or moderate to severe ventriculomegaly
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; extensive T2/FLAIR hyperintensities, involving periventricular white matter involving most of susceptible areas of cerebrum +/- moderate to severe increase in SAS and/or moderate to severe ventriculomegaly
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by diffuse reactive astrocytosis with multiple areas of necrotic foci without inflammation.

items.Grade1: Mild memory impairment
items.Grade2: Moderate memory impairment; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe memory impairment; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a deterioration in memory function.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms

items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms

items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by uncontrolled and purposeless movements.

items.Grade1: Symptomatic; perceived by patient but not evident on physical exam

items.Grade3: Limiting self care ADL

items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by weakness and rapid fatigue of any of the skeletal muscles.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL

items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by involuntary movements of the eyeballs.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by damage or dysfunction of the peripheral sensory nerves.

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort related to a limb or an organ that is removed from or is not physically part of the body.

items.Grade2: Present (e.g., near fainting)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an episode of lightheadedness and dizziness which may precede an episode of syncope.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts of the spinal cord. Symptoms include an increase in the muscle tone in the lower extremities, hyperreflexia, positive Babinski and a decrease in fine motor coordination.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving a nerve root. Patients experience marked discomfort radiating along a nerve path because of spinal pressure on the connecting nerve root.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention indicated (e.g., thyroplasty, vocal cord injection)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by paralysis of the recurrent laryngeal nerve.

items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by headaches, mental status changes, visual disturbances, and/or seizures associated with imaging findings of posterior leukoencephalopathy. It has been observed in association with hypertensive encephalopathy, eclampsia, and immunosuppressive and cytotoxic drug treatment. It is an acute or subacute reversible condition. Also known as posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome (PRES).

items.Grade1: Brief partial seizure and no loss of consciousness
items.Grade2: Brief generalized seizure
items.Grade3: New onset seizures (partial or generalized); multiple seizures despite medical intervention
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

items.Grade1: Mild but more than usual drowsiness or sleepiness
items.Grade2: Moderate sedation; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Obtundation or stupor
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by characterized by excessive sleepiness and drowsiness.

items.Grade1: Mild or slight increase in muscle tone
items.Grade2: Moderate increase in muscle tone and increase in resistance through range of motion
items.Grade3: Severe increase in muscle tone and increase in resistance through range of motion
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; unable to move active or passive range of motion
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by increased involuntary muscle tone that affects the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances.

items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by pressure on the spinal cord.

items.Grade1: Incidental radiographic findings only
items.Grade2: Mild to moderate neurologic deficit; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe neurologic deficit; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease or absence of blood supply to the brain caused by obstruction (thrombosis or embolism) of an artery resulting in neurological damage.

items.Grade3: Fainting; orthostatic collapse
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by spontaneous loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood supply to the brain.

items.Grade1: Ankle reflex reduced
items.Grade2: Ankle reflex absent; other reflexes reduced
items.Grade3: Absence of all reflexes
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by less than normal deep tendon reflexes.
items.NavigationalNote: Also consider Nervous system disorders: Peripheral motor neuropathy or Peripheral sensory neuropathy

items.Grade1: Mild neurologic deficit with or without imaging confirmation
items.Grade2: Moderate neurologic deficit with or without imaging confirmation
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a brief attack (less than 24 hours) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.
items.NavigationalNote: If >24 hours, Consider Nervous system disorders: Stroke

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the uncontrolled shaking movement of the whole body or individual parts.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the trigeminal nerve (fifth cranial nerve).

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the trochlear nerve (fourth cranial nerve).

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the vagus nerve (tenth cranial nerve).

items.Grade3: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden drop of the blood pressure, bradycardia, and peripheral vasodilation that may lead to loss of consciousness. It results from an increase in the stimulation of the vagus nerve.

items.Grade2: <10% percentile of weight for gestational age
items.Grade3: <5% percentile of weight for gestational age
items.Grade4: <1% percentile of weight for gestational age
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inhibition of fetal growth resulting in the inability of the fetus to achieve its potential weight.

items.Grade4: Fetal loss at any gestational age
items.Definition: Death in utero.

items.CTCAETerm: Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Delivery of a liveborn infant at >34 to 37 weeks gestation
items.Grade2: Delivery of a liveborn infant at >28 to 34 weeks gestation
items.Grade3: Delivery of a liveborn infant at 24 to 28 weeks gestation
items.Grade4: Delivery of a liveborn infant at 24 weeks of gestation or less
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by delivery of a viable infant before the normal end of gestation. Typically, viability is achievable between the twentieth and thirty-seventh week of gestation.

items.Grade1: Mild mood alteration
items.Grade2: Moderate mood alteration
items.Grade3: Severe agitation; hospitalization not indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a state of restlessness associated with unpleasant feelings of irritability and tension.

items.Grade1: Inability to achieve orgasm not adversely affecting relationship
items.Grade2: Inability to achieve orgasm adversely affecting relationship
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to achieve orgasm.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.

items.Grade1: Mild disorientation
items.Grade2: Moderate disorientation; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe disorientation; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior.

items.Grade1: Delay in achieving orgasm not adversely affecting relationship
items.Grade2: Delay in achieving orgasm adversely affecting relationship
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by sexual dysfunction characterized by a delay in climax.

items.Grade1: Mild acute confusional state
items.Grade2: Moderate and acute confusional state; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe and acute confusional state; limiting self care ADL; urgent intervention indicated; new onset
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the acute and sudden development of confusion, illusions, movement changes, inattentiveness, agitation, and hallucinations. Usually, it is a reversible condition.

items.Grade2: Moderate delusional symptoms
items.Grade3: Severe delusional symptoms; hospitalization not indicated; new onset
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by false personal beliefs held contrary to reality, despite contradictory evidence and common sense.

items.Grade1: Mild depressive symptoms
items.Grade2: Moderate depressive symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe depressive symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization not indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by melancholic feelings of grief or unhappiness.

items.Grade1: Mild mood elevation
items.Grade2: Moderate mood elevation
items.Grade3: Severe mood elevation (e.g., hypomania)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an exaggerated feeling of well-being which is disproportionate to events and stimuli.

items.Grade1: Mild hallucinations (e.g., perceptual distortions)
items.Grade2: Moderate hallucinations
items.Grade3: Severe hallucinations; hospitalization not indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a false sensory perception in the absence of an external stimulus.

items.Grade1: Mild difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
items.Grade2: Moderate difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
items.Grade3: Severe difficulty in falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early

items.Grade1: Mild; easily consolable

items.Grade1: Decrease in sexual interest not adversely affecting relationship
items.Grade2: Decrease in sexual interest adversely affecting relationship
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in sexual desire.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in sexual desire.

items.Grade1: Mild manic symptoms (e.g., elevated mood, rapid thoughts, rapid speech, decreased need for sleep)
items.Grade2: Moderate manic symptoms (e.g., relationship and work difficulties; poor hygiene)
items.Grade3: Severe manic symptoms (e.g., hypomania; major sexual or financial indiscretions); hospitalization not indicated; new onset
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by excitement of psychotic proportions manifested by mental and physical hyperactivity, disorganization of behavior and elevation of mood.

items.Grade1: Mild personality change
items.Grade2: Moderate personality change
items.Grade3: Severe personality change; hospitalization not indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a conspicuous change in a person's behavior and thinking.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; hospitalization or urgent intervention indicated

items.Grade1: Mild psychotic symptoms

items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to rest, relax or be still.

items.Grade1: Increased thoughts of death but no wish to kill oneself

items.Grade3: Specific plan to commit suicide without serious intent to die which may not require hospitalization
items.Grade4: Specific plan to commit suicide with serious intent to die which requires hospitalization

items.Grade3: Suicide attempt or gesture without intent to die
items.Grade4: Suicide attempt with intent to die which requires hospitalization

items.Grade3: Hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the acute loss of renal function (within 2 weeks) and is traditionally classified as pre-renal (low blood flow into kidney), renal (kidney damage) and post-renal causes (ureteral or bladder outflow obstruction).

items.CTCAEv5Change: Addition: Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 3, Definition; Deletion: Grade 1, 2

items.Grade2: Invasive intervention not indicated
items.Grade3: Invasive intervention indicated

items.Grade1: Intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Antispasmodics indicated
items.Grade3: Hospitalization indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden and involuntary contraction of the bladder wall.

items.Grade1: eGFR (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate) or CrCl (creatinine clearance) <LLN - 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 or proteinuria 2+ present; urine protein/creatinine >0.5
items.Grade2: eGFR or CrCl 59 - 30 ml/min/1.73 m2
items.Grade3: eGFR or CrCl 29 - 15 ml/min/1.73 m2
items.Grade4: eGFR or CrCl <15 ml/min/1.73 m2; dialysis or renal transplant indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by gradual and usually permanent loss of kidney function resulting in renal failure.

items.Grade1: Microscopic hematuria; minimal increase in frequency, urgency, dysuria, or nocturia; new onset of incontinence
items.Grade2: Moderate hematuria; moderate increase in frequency, urgency, dysuria, nocturia or incontinence; urinary catheter placement or bladder irrigation indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Gross hematuria; transfusion, IV medications, or hospitalization indicated; elective invasive intervention indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by painful urination.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate glucose in the urine.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; urinary catheter or bladder irrigation indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Gross hematuria; transfusion, IV medications, or hospitalization indicated; elective invasive intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate blood in the urine.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate the presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.
items.NavigationalNote: Report underlying AE if > Grade 1

items.Grade3: Not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by symptoms that include severe edema, proteinuria, and hypoalbuminemia; it is indicative of renal dysfunction.

items.Grade1: 1+ proteinuria; urinary protein ULN - <1.0 g/24 hrs
items.Grade2:
Adult: 2+ and 3+ proteinuria; urinary protein 1.0 - <3.5 g/24 hrs; 

Pediatric: Urine P/C (Protein/Creatinine) ratio 0.5 - 1.9
items.Grade3:
Adult: Urinary protein >=3.5 g/24 hrs; 4+ proteinuria;

Pediatric: Urine P/C (Protein/Creatinine) ratio >1.9
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate the presence of excessive protein in the urine. It is predominantly albumin, but also globulin.
items.NavigationalNote: 24-hour urine collection takes precedence over dipstick

items.CTCAETerm: Renal and urinary disorders - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; occasional use of nonprescription analgesics indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; oral antiemetics indicated; around the clock nonprescription analgesics or any oral narcotic analgesics indicated
items.Grade3: Hospitalization indicated; IV intervention (e.g., analgesics, antiemetics); elective invasive intervention indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the formation of crystals/kidney stones in the pelvis of the kidney.

items.Grade1: Mild pain not interfering with activity; nonprescription medication indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL; prescription medication indicated
items.Grade3: Hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Analgesics and hematocrit monitoring indicated
items.Grade3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated; hospitalization

items.Grade2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
items.Grade3: Invasive intervention indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between any part of the urinary system and another organ or anatomic site.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Grade2: Limiting instrumental ADL; medical management indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by urination at short intervals.

items.Grade1: Occasional (e.g., with coughing, sneezing, etc.), pads not indicated

items.Grade3: Intervention indicated (e.g., clamp, collagen injections); operative intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade3: Elective invasive intervention indicated; substantial loss of affected kidney function or mass

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated

items.Grade3: Altered organ function (e.g., hydronephrosis or renal dysfunction); invasive intervention indicated

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Present
items.Grade2: Limiting instrumental ADL; medical management indicated

items.Grade1: Present

items.Grade1: Minimal asymmetry; minimal atrophy
items.Grade2: Moderate asymmetry; moderate atrophy
items.Grade3: Asymmetry >1/3 of breast volume; severe atrophy

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated

items.Grade2: Moderate discomfort or pain associated with vaginal penetration; discomfort or pain partially relieved with use of vaginal lubricants or estrogen
items.Grade3: Severe discomfort or pain associated with vaginal penetration; discomfort or pain unrelieved by vaginal lubricants or estrogen

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
