items.Grade2: Target lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with skin tenderness
items.Grade3: Target lesions covering >30% BSA and associated with oral or genital erosions
items.Grade4: Target lesions covering >30% BSA; associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by target lesions (a pink-red ring around a pale center).

items.Grade2: Erythema covering >90% BSA without associated symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., pruritus or tenderness); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by generalized inflammatory erythema and exfoliation. The inflammatory process involves > 90% of the body surface area.

items.Grade1: Covering <10% BSA and asymptomatic
items.Grade2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with erythema or tenderness; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Covering >30% BSA; associated with erythema or tenderness; limiting self-care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by shrinking of adipose tissue.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by change in hair color or loss of normal pigmentation.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the way the hair feels.

items.Grade1: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that the patient is able to camouflage by periodic shaving, bleaching, or removal of hair
items.Grade2: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that requires daily shaving or consistent destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of excess hair growth in women in anatomic sites where growth is considered to be a secondary male characteristic and under androgen control (beard, moustache, chest, abdomen).

items.Grade1: Limited to one site (palms, soles, or axillae); self care interventions
items.Grade2: Involving >1 site; patient seeks medical intervention; associated with psychosocial impact
items.Grade3: Associated with electrolyte/hemodynamic imbalance
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive sweating.
items.NavigationalNote: Synonym: Night sweats, diaphoresis
items.CTCAEv5Change: Addition: Navigational note; Clarification: Grade 3, Definition

items.Grade1: Present
items.Grade3: Limiting self-care ADLs
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a thickening of the outer layer of the skin.

items.Grade1: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair that the patient is either able to camouflage by periodic shaving or removal of hairs or is not concerned enough about the overgrowth to use any form of hair removal
items.Grade2: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair at least on the usual exposed areas of the body [face (not limited to beard/moustache area) plus/minus arms] that requires frequent shaving or use of destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by hair density or length beyond the accepted limits of normal in a particular body region, for a particular age or race.

items.Grade2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Increase in body temperature; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by reduced sweating.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic and covering <10% BSA
items.Grade2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated tenderness; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Covering >30% BSA and associated tenderness and narcotics or NSAIDs indicated; lipohypertrophy; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by hypertrophy of the subcutaneous adipose tissue at the site of multiple subcutaneous injections of insulin.

items.Grade1: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the nails.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the color of the nail plate.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic separation of the nail bed from the nail plate or nail loss
items.Grade2: Symptomatic separation of the nail bed from the nail plate or nail loss; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by loss of all or a portion of the nail.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by vertical or horizontal ridges on the nails.

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin.

items.Grade1: Minimal skin changes or dermatitis (e.g., erythema, edema, or hyperkeratosis) without pain
items.Grade2: Skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, fissures, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, fissures, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by redness, marked discomfort, swelling, and tingling in the palms of the hands or the soles of the feet. Also known as Hand-Foot Syndrome.

items.Grade1: Painless erythema and erythema covering <10% BSA
items.Grade2: Tender erythema covering 10 - 30% BSA
items.Grade3: Erythema covering >30% BSA and erythema with blistering; photosensitivity; oral corticosteroid therapy indicated; pain control indicated (e.g., narcotics or NSAIDs)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in sensitivity of the skin to light.

items.Grade1: Mild or localized; topical intervention indicated
items.Grade2: Widespread and intermittent; skin changes from scratching (e.g., edema, papulation, excoriations, lichenification, oozing/crusts); oral intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Widespread and constant; limiting self care ADL or sleep; systemic corticosteroid or immunosuppressive therapy indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an intense itching sensation.

items.Grade1: Combined area of lesions covering <10% BSA
items.Grade2: Combined area of lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; bleeding with trauma
items.Grade3: Combined area of lesions covering >30% BSA; spontaneous bleeding
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by hemorrhagic areas of the skin and mucous membrane. Newer lesions appear reddish in color. Older lesions are usually a darker purple color and eventually become a brownish-yellow color.

items.Grade1: Papules and/or pustules covering <10% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness
items.Grade2: Papules and/or pustules covering 10 - 30% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness; associated with psychosocial impact; limiting instrumental ADL; papules and/or pustules covering > 30% BSA with or without mild symptoms
items.Grade3: Papules and/or pustules covering >30% BSA with moderate or severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL; associated with local superinfection with oral antibiotics indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; papules and/or pustules covering any % BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness and are associated with extensive superinfection with IV antibiotics indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an eruption of papules and pustules, typically appearing in face, scalp, upper chest and back.

items.Grade1: Macules/papules covering <10% BSA with or without symptoms (e.g., pruritus, burning, tightness)
items.Grade2: Macules/papules covering 10 - 30% BSA with or without symptoms (e.g., pruritus, burning, tightness); limiting instrumental ADL; rash covering > 30% BSA with or without mild symptoms
items.Grade3: Macules/papules covering >30% BSA with moderate or severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of macules (flat) and papules (elevated). Also known as morbillform rash, it is one of the most common cutaneous adverse events, frequently affecting the upper trunk, spreading centripetally and associated with pruritis.

items.Grade1: Mild pain
items.Grade2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin covering the top and the back of the head.

items.CTCAETerm: Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Covering <10% BSA; associated with telangiectasias or changes in skin color
items.Grade2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA; associated with striae or adnexal structure loss
items.Grade3: Covering >30% BSA; associated with ulceration
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the degeneration and thinning of the epidermis and dermis.

items.Grade1: Hyperpigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
items.Grade2: Hyperpigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by darkening of the skin due to excessive melanin deposition.

items.Grade1: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
items.Grade2: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by loss of skin pigment (e.g., vitiligo).

items.Grade1: Mild induration, able to move skin parallel to plane (sliding) and perpendicular to skin (pinching up)
items.Grade2: Moderate induration, able to slide skin, unable to pinch skin; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe induration; unable to slide or pinch skin; limiting joint or orifice movement (e.g., mouth, anus); limiting self care ADL
items.Grade4: Generalized; associated with signs or symptoms of impaired breathing or feeding
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an area of hardness in the skin.

items.Grade1: Combined area of ulcers <1 cm; nonblanchable erythema of intact skin with associated warmth or edema
items.Grade2: Combined area of ulcers 1 - 2 cm; partial thickness skin loss involving skin or subcutaneous fat
items.Grade3: Combined area of ulcers >2 cm; full-thickness skin loss involving damage to or necrosis of subcutaneous tissue that may extend down to fascia
items.Grade4: Any size ulcer with extensive destruction, tissue necrosis, or damage to muscle, bone, or supporting structures with or without full thickness skin loss
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a circumscribed, erosive lesion on the skin.

items.Grade3: Skin sloughing covering <10% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment, and mucous membrane detachment)
items.Grade4: Skin sloughing covering 10 - 30% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment and mucous membrane detachment)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by less than 10% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by air in the subcutaneous tissue.

items.Grade1: Telangiectasias covering <10% BSA
items.Grade2: Telangiectasias covering >=10% BSA; associated with psychosocial impact
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by local dilatation of small vessels resulting in red discoloration of the skin or mucous membranes.

items.Grade4: Skin sloughing covering >=30% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., erythema, purpura, or epidermal detachment)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by greater than 30% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

items.Grade1: Urticarial lesions covering <10% BSA; topical intervention indicated
items.Grade2: Urticarial lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; oral intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Urticarial lesions covering >30% BSA; IV intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an itchy skin eruption characterized by wheals with pale interiors and well-defined red margins.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.CTCAETerm: Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify
items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
Urgent intervention indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; hemodynamic or neurologic instability; organ damage; loss of extremity(ies)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of an arterial vessel by a blood clot that develops in an artery.
items.NavigationalNote: Consider Nervous system disorders: TIA or Stroke for CNS-related events or Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by leakage of intravascular fluids into the extravascular space. This syndrome is observed in patients who demonstrate a state of generalized leaky capillaries following shock syndromes, low-flow states, ischemia-reperfusion injuries, toxemias, medications, or poisoning. It can lead to generalized edema and multiple organ failure.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Symptomatic, associated with hypotension and/or tachycardia; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by episodic reddening of the skin, especially face, neck, or chest.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Minimally invasive evacuation or aspiration indicated
items.Grade3: Transfusion; invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a localized collection of blood, usually clotted, in an organ, space, or tissue, due to a break in the wall of a blood vessel.

items.Grade1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by an uncomfortable and temporary sensation of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating upon cooling.

items.Grade3:
Adult: Systolic BP >=160 mm Hg or diastolic BP >=100 mm Hg; medical intervention indicated; more than one drug or more intensive therapy than previously used indicated;

Pediatric and adolescent: Systolic and/or diastolic > 5 mmHg above the 99th percentile
items.Grade4: Adult and Pediatric: Life-threatening consequences (e.g., malignant hypertension, transient or permanent neurologic deficit, hypertensive crisis); urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a pathological increase in blood pressure.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Medical intervention indicated; hospitalization indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences and urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a blood pressure that is below the normal expected for an individual in a given environment.

items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by the loss of lymph fluid into the surrounding tissue or body cavity.

items.Grade1: Trace thickening or faint discoloration
items.Grade2: Marked discoloration; leathery skin texture; papillary formation; limiting instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive fluid collection in tissues that causes swelling.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a cystic lesion containing lymph.

items.Grade2: Brief (<24 hrs) episode of ischemia managed medically and without permanent deficit
items.Grade3: Prolonged (>=24 hrs) or recurring symptoms and/or invasive intervention indicated
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of end organ damage; urgent operative intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by impaired circulation to an extremity.

items.Grade2: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the wall of a vein.

items.Grade2: Present
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by a blood clot and inflammation involving a superficial vein of the extremities.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic; incidental finding of SVC thrombosis
items.Grade2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, radiation or chemotherapy)
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms; multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, chemotherapy, radiation, stenting)
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., lysis, thrombectomy, surgery)
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by obstruction of the blood flow in the superior vena cava. Signs and symptoms include swelling and cyanosis of the face, neck, and upper arms, cough, orthopnea and headache.

items.Grade1: Medical intervention not indicated (e.g., superficial thrombosis)
items.Grade2: Medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Urgent medical intervention indicated (e.g., pulmonary embolism or intracardiac thrombus)
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences with hemodynamic or neurologic instability
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
items.NavigationalNote: Consider Nervous system disorders: TIA or Stroke for CNS-related events. Use Vascular disorders: Arterial thromboembolism for arterial thrombi.

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
items.Grade3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

items.Grade1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
items.Grade2: Moderate symptoms, medical intervention indicated
items.Grade3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
items.Grade4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of peripheral or visceral ischemia; urgent intervention indicated
items.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving the wall of a vessel.
